website_summaries.verdict: Bakers – even those in the gluten-free camp – will love this set from Bread Bosses.
pros: Works well with any recipe involving flour, water, salt and yeast
Natural rattan cane material wicks moisture away from surface for crispy, round crust
cons: If you have concerns about sticking, be sure to "season" the bowl with rice flour first

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell
customer_reviews.text: I received the banneton quickly. Once I opened the packaging I was hit with a terrible smell from the banneton. I tried washing the banneton but it still has a weird smell associated with it. I was told to request a replacement which I have done, I’ll update when I find out what the resolution is.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Much better bread with this basket!
customer_reviews.text: I have always had a difficult time getting my bread to rise properly in my drafty old house, this proofing basket has increased my proper proofing to 100% success. To date, since implementing this basket, every loaf has proofed beautifully without changing any other parts of my process. Make sure to flour well to decrease sticking and make sure the cover is on the very top rung, the dough will fill the cover - I have actually had it rise so well that it popped the cover off!
customer_reviews.author: A. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to your bread baking tools!
customer_reviews.text: Enjoying this addition to my growing banneton collection. The depth to width ratio is perfect for the size/shape I like in my boules, and I love the dough scraper that came with it! Much more functional for removing dough from its container than others I’ve used. One thing of note: the logo on my scraper flaked off a bit, but the company has resolved the problem for future orders and will send a replacement scraper to anyone having that issue free of charge. I appreciate that kind of customer service!
customer_reviews.author: James Harper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent banneton with high quality liner and scraper!
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality of this proofing basket! Banneton comes with well made linen liner that easily prevents the dough from sticking, allowing the dough the easily tip out before slashing and baking. The bowl scraper is excellent - nice and flexible, works better than the other scrapers I've used in the past that are more firm and don't conform the the various bowl sizes as well. Certainly helps make your job even easier! Perfect for my purposes (1kg dough) 👍
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Unusable due to smell
customer_reviews.text: When I took the banner on out of its package I was immediately hit by a horrible smell - it smells almost like decay or some sort of rot. It’s clung to both the basket and the linen wrap despite multiple washes, and it’s so strong that if I keep it anywhere it my kitchen it stinks up the entire room. It renders the whole thing unusable, since I don’t want my bread to smell like a rotting corpse. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Hey, I just used this for the very first time today...I got it mainly to try and use the refrigerator method to slow raise my sourdough that I have been making for a couple years...this is so great I am thinking about buying another one so I can do two at a time....just getting used to this but it's great... Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Gordon A. Yumibe

customer_reviews.title: Tons of splinters/wicker hairs
customer_reviews.text: I paid a little more for this proofing basket over others because of the rave reviews and the “good wicker” claim. Maybe I have unrealistic expectations or maybe I got a bad one, but there are TONS of wicker hairs/splinters all over mine! I’m super disappointed. I wanted to contact the company before reviewing but the amazon app doesn’t seem to have that option (or I can’t find it??). Maybe this is normal and I should just use it? I don’t know!!
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Great package, especially for beginning bread bakers or bakers looking to add to their collection!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my everyday loaves. The basket is lightweight and narrow/deep enough to encourage my dough to hold its shape. I like that this is an all-in-one package that comes with a liner and a dough scraper (far more flexible of a scraper than I’ve ever seen come with this kind of package, and better shaped for helping release dough from its bulk bin). The logo on my scraper started to flake off a bit, but the company said they will send a free replacement to anyone having that issue, and they’ve resolved the problem for future customers. Overall, I’m happy with the product- enough that I will start recommending this package to my beginning sourdough students.
customer_reviews.author: James Harper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome👌🏻
customer_reviews.text: The bread in the pic was a 1.2 kg bread (2.6 lbs), so dont think the oval banneton is too small. Its perfect for batards shaped bread. This banneton is my 2nd one from Bread Bosses and I’d say it’s very nice and works smoothely. It comes with an Orange dough scraper (the logo comes off but they offer a free replacement). Very neat banneton!👌🏻
customer_reviews.author: legendary

customer_reviews.title: Tiny rattan strands everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Small strands of rattan everywhere. I'm worried it's in my bread. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. I have another basket, not from this company, that never had this problem. UPDATE: I returned the basket in the pics for a replacement. Figured I'd give them a seconds chance. The replacement was worse. There were 3 separate pieces used to make the 9" bowl. I have a 10" from a different company that use one single rattan strip to make the entire basket. This one had strands everywhere too.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm venturing into the world of sourdough bread baking and decided to try the banneton method. I followed the instructions for prepping the basket, using liberal amounts of flour, and my loaf turned out fantastic with no sticking. I will be buying the round version, too.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Yow

customer_reviews.title: Wicker material has a terrible barnyard smell
customer_reviews.text: Unusable. It has a terrible odor that remains after washing exactly like a barnyard. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: with a little extra research, I was able to be happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: well, once i finally learned to use brown rice flour, i didn't really like this product. i followed the instructions initially (wetting then flouring it, then just flour afterwards). my first few loaves just still stuck to the basket and ruined all the previous work I've put into it folding and retarding the dough. Then i used a floured linen towel, and that worked better. also the liner worked well to with lots of flouring. after researching a few blogs, the secret was the rice flour. Even with a lazy sprinkling the dough just comes right off. So now I'm pleased with this proofing basket.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Don't Be Fooled By Imitations!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been brave enough to use it without the liner yet, since the whole purpose I bought this product was to have a gentler transfer to the baking pan to avoid the degassing I was having with an otherwise tasty recipe, but I know that I can. I've seen a lot of these on the market with really awful material comprising the actual bowl. No worries for weird splinters in your beautiful bread, with this banneton, the inside is smooth as silk. The scraper is a nice bonus. I hadn't picked one up yet, but had been planning on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Womack

customer_reviews.title: A poorly made version
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to have a new tool! It’s poorly made. The interior has sharp edges and is not rounded it should be. Staples are exposed from top to bottom. Just the very cheapest, low quality proofing basket a company could come up with.
customer_reviews.author: SomeBummedGuy

customer_reviews.title: Will serve their purpose after a clean-up
customer_reviews.text: I am giving a 3 because they (I ordered a round and an oval banneton) arrived with several tiny dead bugs all over the cover, which was kinda gag-worthy. I am washing those straight away. The proofing bowls themselves look to be sufficiently made. They have some scraggly parts, but they can be trimmed before using. I haven’t used them yet, so I can’t comment on that. Edited to add: Both bannetons work great. I coated them with cornstarch because it was what I had on hand and I had zero issues getting them out. Added a photo of an oval loaf I made with the banneton. Be careful when washing the covers as I had a lot of shrinkage.
customer_reviews.author: Briana Vander Kooy

customer_reviews.title: It's a crap shoot..buy if you like to gamble.
customer_reviews.text: I will never order from Bread Boss again. There is no consistency in their baskets. I have ordered several different shapes 10 inch, 9 inch round and oval and they look like they came from different places. Slivers of wood, staples, inconsistent sizes...it's a gamble with this seller...... I have tried to contact them several times through E-mails and I have yet to hear back from them. Not happy at all. I am ordering from another seller now.
customer_reviews.author: diane hennings

customer_reviews.title: Excellent proofing basket!
customer_reviews.text: Great results! Fun for larger loaves. Good build quality. The scraper it comes with is excellent, and when the scraper had a minor issue of the logo peeling off, they offered to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Luigi Bella

customer_reviews.title: Quality bread basket for proofing!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely my favorite banneton! Excellent quality materials, and love the liner that makes it super easy to top out the dough after proofing! The bowl scraper is excellent - nice and flexible, works better than the other scrapers I've used in the past that are more firm. Conforms perfectly to any size bowl I'm using. Love love love!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the great price.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy baking sourdough breads. When I have started to bake I tried to use different DIY proofing basket solutions. If you want a perfect shape and quality of your bread, the proofing basket is "must to have" thing. There are different bannetons on the market, but Bread Bosses' product is high quality and is 200% worth the price. The linen fits perfectly. It is not flimsy at all. The scraper is a great touch, I use it to clean the bowls. The round shape of it follows the shape of the bowl perfectly. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Maxim G.

customer_reviews.title: Just left sadden!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So when I first purchased this everything looked great. No splinters...didn’t have an odor....linen looked good. But after the FIRST use of over night proofing in the basket there are a TON of splinters!!!! So lame....I was so excited to finally use a basket. Bread still came out good and raised but idk if there are splinters in my bread or not. So sad!!! After all the stretching and folding and repeat I’m just like damn are there splinters in my bread now?!?!??!?
customer_reviews.author: Elleii

customer_reviews.title: Great Proofing Basket
customer_reviews.text: This proofing basket, scraper, and liner are just what I needed and wanted, and at a great price. The basket is sturdy and small, but appropriate for what I needed it for. You can get a lot of dough into the basket, so don't let its size fool you. The dough will fit in the basket nicely and it will grow overnight (the dough, not the basket :)) and make a big round loaf of bread. You will be very satisfied with your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Onyx girl

customer_reviews.title: You must use rice flour!!!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was having a devil of a time with this. My main recipe is a relatively wet sourdough (think just slightly drier than no-knead) and it stuck every. dang. time. So bad. I had spritzed with water and added TONS of flour. Then before throwing it away (hard) I decided to watch the video. (I think it was the video) and I noticed they said use RICE flour. Skeptical, I soaked the crap out of the basked and scraped, scraped, scraped the stuck bread dough out of the banneton and after it was squeaky clean and fully dried, spritzed and coated with rice flour. PERFECTION. Haven't had a single issue since.
customer_reviews.author: Angela_GTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great quality bread proofing baskets
customer_reviews.text: We at Hope’s Artisan Bread love the bannetons from Bread Bosses. They hold up well and keep to high standards. The customer service is very reliable and friendly, too! I had a few questions about the scraper and they responded quickly. The logo scratches off. They responded offering a free replacement scraper and just love the company! You will too! Oh and love the shape and roundness of the scraper, you will too!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Mendrin

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Well made and worked very well right out of the box. Seemed a little spendy compared to others on the market but its probably a case of getting what you pay for. Great communication from seller right off the bat. The suggest using rice flour to get bread to release but I had no problem with using AP flour after spritzing with water per their instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Kingbird

customer_reviews.title: Big gap in the basket very 😢
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two a 10 inch round and a 10 inch oval. The 10 inch oval is defective it has a 1/2 inch gap in its botton. When proofing my dough it expands into the gap and always sticks when trying to remove it. So its a 50/50 here, because I have not had a problem with the round one. Very dis dissatisfied with the oval one being it it aggravating to work with and had been rendered useless as far as I'm concerned 😟
customer_reviews.author: diane hennings

customer_reviews.title: First time using a proofing basket.
customer_reviews.text: My first time using a proofing basket and I love it. It worked perfectly. No issues with the dough sticking. I've already ordered more!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Favorite banneton I own!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent proofing basket, my favorite one that I own! Perfect, sturdy construction, easy to clean. I use with the liner as well as without, works like a charm. Holds small doughs (250g total flour) and very large doughs (1000g total flour). I often leave the dough in the banneton overnight in the refrigerator... Never develops any mold or cracking. Stellar product!! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I've used this basket for a few months now and it's nice quality and works well! I don't use the fabric liner much anymore as I prefer the look of the basket pattern on the bread, just make sure you coat generously with flour. I also really like the scraper -- it doesn't stick to the dough, so it's perfect for working my sourdough without having to get it all over my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: RedGale

customer_reviews.title: Works great for bread proofing
customer_reviews.text: This banneton is my 1st ever purchase for bread making. It does the work well, I seasoned it according to instructions and use with a liner. I wash the liner by hand and line dry, and it didn't shrink as I feared it might being a natural linen. I don't really clean the banneton, just make sure it's completely dry before storing, but might need to when baking without a liner. The bench scraper/knife is surprisingly well for lifting the edge of a high hydration dough and easy to clean. Happy baking and thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Gal

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it's me
customer_reviews.text: I've had a round Banneton before and had no issues with it, if it was liberally floured. I followed the instructions that came with this, misted it with water and thoroughly floured the sides and bottom, tossing the flour all around into every crevice. Using a slightly wet dough that was only a bit tacky, I wound up with nearly 20% of the dough sticking to the bottom. I don't recall cleaning issues with my previous round one. And after a thorough cleaning with an ice pick, the same thing happened a second time, but not as severely. It's easy to use, very sturdy, but I'm not optimistic about the third (next) try.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: Bread Bosses 9” Banneton is Top Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of the 9” inch Bannetons because from the pictures I could tell they were awesome. I received the in 2. Days both in perfect condition. I seasoned them and use one the same day. The results were awesome. I finally can make professional looking sourdough bread. The product is built well and very sturdy. Bread Bosses cares about their customers to make sure you are satisfied. Take a look at the first time I used the Bread Bosses banneton. I am very satisfied and the free scraper is awesome too.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M

customer_reviews.title: More expensive does not equate to better quality!
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazon choice and because it was , in some cases, almost twice as expensive, i thought it was going to be a better product. NOT SO! Just an ordinary basket cheaply made! The only benefit, per the ratings, was the email and the email video . Good PR without a superior product! Oh, the product was sent in an envelope! glad it did not crack, although their great PR said it would replace it if that occurred.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed! Yuck!
customer_reviews.text: I was going to use it today for the first time. So I take a closer look to see how to prepare it to put my sourdough to proof overnight. There's not only splinters I a few areas, but they painted an area that had some black something or other between the material, and the paint was coming off!! I'm so glad I took a good look. Otherwise we would have been eating not only the dried paint but also the Black mold or whatever that black spots are. So disgusting! I was so excited to finally use banneton. I wanted to try one and order a second right after. I guess instead I will be returning this one. :(
customer_reviews.author: MKS

customer_reviews.title: Good product, excellent support
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the first proofing basket in October, and the second one a few months later. I am a relative newbie, baking 1-2 loaves of sourdough bread each week. The proofing baskets have both worked well for me. Construction is good with few, if any, splinters (nothing affecting food).I had an issue with sticking once or twice., and was able to address it by using a brush to remove caked flour, then using ample flour on the next 2 - 3 times I baked. The support has been great. While I have not yet tried the recipe provided, I found the video and instructions to be valuable as I become more familiar with sourdough and higher-hydration baking.
customer_reviews.author: a.coder

customer_reviews.title: Great product and service!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and service! The company is very personable and helpful with questions! I made my first whole wheat einkorn sourdough bread today. I was supposed to spritz the basket with water and then sprinkle with flour for the first use, but couldn’t find the directions until after I add already sprinkled it with brown rice flour. However, after proofing, it still came out of the basket beautifully! No sticking and the design is gorgeous!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Baskin

customer_reviews.title: Regret Buying
customer_reviews.text: Watched video 2x, tried using, dough totally stuck to canvas bag, terrible time trying to scrap it off to salvage enough to make a loaf of bread. What a mess. Then took forever trying to wash out the sticky dough out of the canvas bag. Yes, I sprayed the bag with water, had lots of flour on the bag before putting in the dough. I followed the video. I'm going back to my stainless steal bowl and and parchment paper. Works every time. Waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. T

customer_reviews.title: Prevents losing form when transfering to pan for baking
customer_reviews.text: This proofing basket immediately improved the quality of my loaves. My loaves no longer lose form when transferring to the baking pan. I normally use it without the linen cover, but it's nice to have because it can be used to line another bowl if you need to proof two loaves at the same time. I was worried there would be some chemical smell emanating from the rattan that would impart unnatural flavors to the bread, however this was not an issue at all. The only thing I don't like is that there was some fine splintering in the rattan, however, I was able to get rid of it by gently rubbing the basket with my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of garbage. The bamboo is fraying and broken around in some parts that no matteR how dusted it is, the bread gets stuck. This morning, the middle coil came out completely along with the dough. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Couturediva

customer_reviews.title: Another Friend of Bread Bakers
customer_reviews.text: Why use a banneton? it's simple really. First, it promotes airflow around your dough to promote even, consistent rising. Second, it gives you an attractive pattern for rustic style bread. Third, the linen liner gives you a smooth texture to french style boule (ball) bread. So, you have a lot of flexibility. As the linen liner is removable, it's snap to decide the style of bread you're making. When you use this, ensure you dust enough flour inside so the dough doesn't stick.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D

customer_reviews.title: slipped through quality control
customer_reviews.text: I have several bannetons from this brand and happy with them. This one slipped through quality control. The liner has a hole on the seam that goes in the bottom of the basket and there was some pealing of the cane. The scraper is worthless. It is so thin and flimsy there is no way you could use it on any bread dough. What I can’t figure out is some of the baskets I got from this company came with these crappy yellow scrapers and a couple came with a white halfway decent scraper and then some with a squared of non functional scraper. Why wouldn’t you give the same (and decent) scraper with each basket?
customer_reviews.author: rt4littlebabies

customer_reviews.title: Banneton Proofing Bowl
customer_reviews.text: This rattan proofing bowl arrived promptly...and seems to be the only US shipper of this product....it makes sense to order from Danny....they do all the leg work...and you receive the proofing bowl in a short period of time, rather than it coming from the Orient and having to wait over a month to receive it. With that said...if you follow the included instructions, regarding sealing the interior with flour, etc...it works perfectly and you will have those beautiful lines on your unbaked dough. Yes...when I find the need for another Benneton, I will definitely order from these guys !
customer_reviews.author: vkb

customer_reviews.title: Splinters, can’t seem to get ahold of anyone
customer_reviews.text: Received and looked exactly like the “bad rattan image”. I was sent an automated email asking if everything was ok, responded it wasn’t and sent pictures. Heard back pretty fast the same day, but two follow up emails later and haven’t heard anything back After the original response. I would have rather have worked it out with the seller but looks like I have to return it. Edit: added a picture of the splinters I had to pull out of the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to start shaping my loaves into batards. This proofing basket is an exceptional quality and size for that task. I enjoy using it and would definitely recommend trying different shapes. Even being an oval basket, the loaves proofed in it perfectly fit my Lodge 6 qt dutch oven. Very pleased with this banneton.
customer_reviews.author: Maxim G.

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: After a long month I was finally able to have a baking night. I shaped my loaf and put it into this proofing basket. When I picked it up to move it can the other counter where I set my dough over night, the dang thing cracked and broke. Now I have the task of finding packaging for it and taking it to the post office for return.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Whipple

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good customer service
customer_reviews.text: We are new to home bread baking--as many are these days! My husband is the chief baker, so I bought him this banneton to expand his repertoire. The instructions are easy to follow and the cutting tool comes in handy. And it makes a delicious round loaf. When we received our order, the basket looked cracked in several places. I contacted the seller and they were very responsive. We received a replacement before we even realized one had been sent. We are very happy with this product and recommend it to anyone who is thinking about adding bannetons to their bread baking experience.
customer_reviews.author: CEastman

customer_reviews.title: Makes Good Bread!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this proofing basket because I saw one used on a YouTube Masters Class for sourdough bread. I am really happy with it. It’s a great tool for shaping the dough during the second proofing. I’ve learned bread that isn’t pretty can still taste great but using a proofing basket sure helps. The basket doesn’t have to be detail perfect (as one reviewer unfairly criticized this one) in order to serve its purpose—-to make a good looking and great tasting bread. I’m happy with this basket and the scraper is just fine. For heavens sake, It is supposed to be flexible to loosen your dough from your mixing bowl!
customer_reviews.author: Kj

customer_reviews.title: Best customer service ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I like that I am able to make “designer” bread like you get in old fashioned bakeries. This little bread proofreads really works and it’s easy to us. What’s more, you get lots of help and tips from Danny at Bread Bosses. For this reason alone, I’d only buy from Danny. While I’ve never had to reach out to as any questions, I’ve had lots, Danny has always beaten me to the punch and answered my questions before I had to ask. There may be more proofreads baskets out there, but I’d wager no one has better service and follow up than Danny from Bread Bosses
customer_reviews.author: Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Holds a nice round loaf of bread. Make sure to pre-treat the Banneton before the first time you use it by lightly misting with water, then dusting with flour the day before you are going to proof your bread. After that I just dust it with brown rice flour before I use it and, voila!, a nice load that does not stick to the basket. Remember DO NOT put the basket in the oven; it's not meant to be used that way. Happy baking!
customer_reviews.author: cortiz

customer_reviews.title: Linen Liner? Cover?
customer_reviews.text: Husband: I moistened and floured the cloth......(like a tea towel) as the various 5 min artisan bread websites describe. On an Amazon video it shows dusting the bowl itself with flour. Whats the linen cloth for? It conforms to the inside of the bowl. Ken Forkish book shows the ring marks on his bread...that got me wondering.....am I doing this right? Call me dumb, but it's not clear on the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: molly clause

customer_reviews.title: These worked great and the bowl scraper is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to pout these to use right away. They arrive with instructions and didn't have any peeling or other imperfections. I dusted them with rice flour and made 2 loaves of rye bread that cam our great. You can use the covers if you do not want the lines one the bread, but they looked good to me. Also the bowl scraper is very flexible so it will get into the narrow areas of a bowl and will assist in scraping your cutting board when kneading and shaping. On a side note, it also worked great for shaping icing on a birthday cake we recently made for my son. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Muniz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing quality
customer_reviews.text: I went for Bosses' banneton because of the large number of reviews. The picture on the product page did the trick on me -- "our good rattan vs others bad rattan". Unfortunately, that is not the case with both baskets that I ordered as the quality is quite poor. Splinters all around, holes and gaps, excessive amount of staple gun needles... I attached some pictures, see for youself. After 10 days of no response from their customer service, I am returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: We Have Lift Off
customer_reviews.text: Ever since this basket has arrived at the household, my wife has diligently, dilly dilly, put it to good use for her baking needs. I can testify that bread production has amped up considerably much to my delight. The oval basket is well-made & produces an interesting pattern to the baked goods when the cloth lining is not used. Be sure to follow the break-in instructions in order to avoid any setbacks such as not using enough flour & causing the dough to stick to the basket or cloth instead of freely releasing from it. Just a little persistence goes a long way & the results have been beautiful tasty artisan breads.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Stepp

customer_reviews.title: One of the essentials that helped me move from beginner to intermediate level baker
customer_reviews.text: I'm a somewhat novice baker, having only baked about 100 loaves so far. I used to proof my loaves in a plastic tub, no cloth. Then I tried these bowls with the cloth and rice flour dusting. Still sticky :-( Then I tried PAM spray on the bamboo itself. Heaven. My bread has wonderful concentric rings from the bamboo when it bakes. Suffice it say I've cooked over 20 loaves this way and I'm thrilled.Also appreciated the bread scraper which because it's so flexible, is easier to use on bowls than others.
customer_reviews.author: A. Khosla

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly, no sticking
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to sourdough baking, and all of the recipes I read used a banneton. The day before I used it, I misted it with water and dusted with sorghum flour (I didn't have rice flour,) and let it dry. I did this 3 times to get a good layer of dried flour in it. My dough came out perfectly, no sticking at all. I didn't get the pretty lines in my loaf for some reason, they popped right out when I baked it. But it did it's job and my bread was beautiful. Now I want an oval!
customer_reviews.author: Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Cracks and Splinters
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use this banneton but when I opened it I noticed some loose threads on the side of the linen cloth. Underneath the cloth, I discovered CRACKS in the basket. There's small wood splinters, several that came loose and fell off from the basket when opening. It smells weird too.
customer_reviews.author: WL

customer_reviews.title: Choose another brand
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product is not up to par with my expectation. As you can see from the photo the basket is not well put together! Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Mfro

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Sourdough Bread!
customer_reviews.text: This kit is a great addition to any home Baker making it so easy to shape around loaves perfectly every time. Got this 9 months ago and have enjoyed using it regularly ever since. It's a great value and can be used for most breads, but I found that it really helped with my sourdough recipes because the size matches my Dutch oven without adjustments. Have already recommended to several friends.
customer_reviews.author: Mindo'ermatter

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Got this to make Tartine country bread, which has a high moisture content and is no knead. Dusted the liner with rice flour and whole what for the final rise, and the bread released into the hot cloche with minimal sticking. Rather than rinse out the liner I just shook out the excess flour—hoping that over time the liner will be “seasoned” as some of the bread guides suggest. I also like the flexible plastic scraper - it’s great for getting into the corner of bowls and also for scraping stuff off the bottom of metal plans without scratching.
customer_reviews.author: cycleknit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service!!
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing special about a proofing basket. It's pretty basic at it's core, but I gotta say the Bread Bosses take it to a whole new level. They could sell the product and leave it at that and I would be satisfied. However, they go out of their way to send lessons on how to best use the product. The education portion of the transaction has been invaluable. These guys do service right. They connect with me, asking about the service, making sure the product is working and teach me how to use it. A+++ seller. Thanks guys!
customer_reviews.author: David Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a little learning curve
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a year ago and tried using a few times to mixed success. Mostly I ended up with a message of dough stuck it, and I eventually relegated it to a corner of pantry. Then I got the book Flour Water Salt Yeast by Ken Forkish which walks you through bread making using a banneton step by step. It turns out I just wasn't using enough flour to sufficiently coat the banneton. Now my loaves are turning out beautifully and I love my banneton.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect proofing basket
customer_reviews.text: I use these for pain au levain and other such rustic breads and these are perfect. The linen is sturdy, and holds the moistened flour well. When you need to clean them (only if they get something non-baking spilled on'em), the linen is removable and can be hand-washed. The seller is real explicit that they'll fix anything that goes wrong in shipping -- apparently sometimes the basket itself breaks in shipment, but both of mine arrived fine. The longest proof I've done is 18 hours in the fridge, with plastic wrap tucked under the linen's elastic. It released without issue. I wouldn't try that without the linen liner.
customer_reviews.author: James 'Pug' Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great proofing basket, need rice flour to coat it
customer_reviews.text: The proofing basket works great, in fact I bought a round one too. The instructions don’t necessarily tell you to coat it with Rice Flour which is gluten free and makes it easier to avoid the dough sticking to the liner. I don’t normally keep rice flour but ordered it and it works great. Use a spray bottle to wet the liner, sprinkle rice flour on the liner and allow it to dry, then repeat dusting with rice flour again. It makes a real difference. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Ganem III

customer_reviews.title: Perfect baskets
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful proofing baskets! They leave gorgeous lines on the bread and keep the flour up high. I used both the liner and no liner... each were easy to get the bread out. The how to video was a great help to see how to season the baskets.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this banneton but sadly I ended up disappointed. There are a lot of sprinters sticking out all over the banneton and the banneton itself smells like chemical, almost like paint thinner. I'll be returning this item unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to dust liberally with flour or your dough will stick!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent basket and it is very easy to use. Just be sure to dust it liberally with flour, especially before the first time you use it. I didn't add enough and my high-hydration sourdough stuck horribly. It's a bear to clean if that happens. That said, there is the option to use the canvas cover instead, but your loaf will not have the wicker imprints that contrast so beautifully with the scoring. A large part of artisan bread baking is aesthetics, after all! Here is a helpful and short video tutorial on using and cleaning your banneton. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: R. Valerius

customer_reviews.title: So Happy I Came Back For A Second One
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I ended up coming back and ordering a second one because I want to have two loaves going at the same time. I love that it comes with a liner while I learn to get the right consistency. The liner isn’t that bad to clean but it is sourdough so.....that stuff sticks to everything. However I am learning the best way to prep it and it’s no longer sticking to liner. I think next week I will try without the liner so that my bread gets those awesome lines.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Great Banneton makes for great sourdough bread
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this banneton for a few weeks now and I love it. It’s much easier to use than having to line a bowl with a towel. What’s even better is I can use the included linen cloth over a second bowl and have two forms for proofing my boules. I haven’t had a single issue with my dough sticking to the banneton. I would love to get an oval shaped one but they’re completely out of stock now; with good reason.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ong

customer_reviews.title: Bought two and both still had several splinters
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because of the great reviews. The company site also states it is splinter free. It is not. I bought two of them and both had splinters. The basket is sturdy but I would not want rattan splinters in my bread. Gave it three stars because you can use the cloth so the dough doesn't touch the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Strong Bread Basket
customer_reviews.text: I bought the oval banneton for baking sourdough bread for my son. He's been baking different types of bread for 3 years. Was told to use a banneton, tried a round one from a different company but it was falling apart. Decided to give bread bosses a chance with the oval basket as it was a recommendation from a pastry chef who my son follows, so far its holding up. I love how sturdy it looks and we found instructions on how to keep it clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can’t think of anything that I least like..
customer_reviews.text: I can’t think of anything that I least like...except for wishing I had more to gift and another for me! I favor sourdough loaves, so that’s what the first few were, and I took them to my son’s home for a weekend dinner/barbecue...went over very well... my grand kids loved dipping pieces in the sauce! Went through almost half of it by breaking and dipping...I’m very happy for Benneton.
customer_reviews.author: Janet P. Mcdonough

customer_reviews.title: High quality and exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is a great banneton. No splinters found, holds onto a layer of flour nicely. Creates lovely shapes on your dough. Don't really recommend the liner though. I'd rather just use the banneton itself. The liner is a pain to clean. It gets crusty, even when it's drying after it's washed. I just skip it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes beautiful bread!
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed that it definitely helps my loaves rise, and I love the texture that the banneton gives them. Only complaint is that there's a strong straw-like smell from the material that's taking a while to fade, and I'm a little worried about any potential mold growing in it since it's hard to clean between all the cracks. But overall I'm so so happy I purchased it, it's one of my favorite bread-making tools!
customer_reviews.author: medici28

customer_reviews.title: good product. unsure if it is for beginners
customer_reviews.text: i gave this a four star review because i am sure it is a great product. i give it only two stars for ease of use because i am a novice bread maker and my bread does not turn out the way the i expect it should. there isn’t directions with it, there is access to videos for instruction on use but i think my problem lies more with my skill level. this may have just been to fast of a jump for my skill set
customer_reviews.author: brant guilfoyle

customer_reviews.title: I'll get there someday.
customer_reviews.text: Had to spend some time cleaning the inner side of the basket to remove the tiny pieces of reed to make it really smooth. I am still trying to figure out gluten-free artisan bread. I did get 1 loaf to be dry enough to hold together in the banneton. Most recipes are not made for this use, too wet. I really admire bakers. I'll get there eventually. This banneton will get more use. It feels sturdy and I hope to use it for a long time. Be careful with the cover. I hand washed mine in warm/hot water and let it air dry, it shrunk a little. The tools are nice, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Looking Loaves I've Ever Made
customer_reviews.text: I had been baking sourdough bread regularly for a couple of years, and generally my loaves were fit for family but not company. They tasted great, but my hand-shaping of the loaves left a lot to be desired. I heard about bannetons as a potential help for my problem and purchased this one based on the favorable reviews. After using it for a short time, I'm really happy. Bread Bosses provided helpful information (partially via an email through Amazon) that enabled me to understand exactly how to use their product. The result? Loaves of bread I'd be proud to serve to guests.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Nice basket. Works great. Came with a plastic scraper so you can get all the flour off your countertop. The other great thing about this basket is that it comes with an email so you can communicate with the seller. If you have any questions or problems - you can contact them. Also a portion of your purchase can go to charity. Nice. I recommend paring this purchase with 2 things - Flour Salt Water Yeast cookbook an Emile Henry brand bread cloche. Combined, these three things can make delicious artisan bread.
customer_reviews.author: Good Purchase

customer_reviews.title: I love my proofing baskets
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about the need for a proofing basket but gave it a try and I am impressed with the results. When the basket is floured the dough pops out very easily and holds its shape nicely. It makes my homemade bread look and taste professional. I would now never make bread without one. I ordered them in every shape. I do not wash the basket or liner. I shake out excess flour and leave the basket out until the remaining flour is very dry and then I store it in a dry place. If I did want to wash it, though, It is easy to remove the liner.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Breadmaking is so rewarding
customer_reviews.text: During this pandemic, I've returned to some of my southern cuisine roots as well as experimenting with various breadmaking recommendations. The proofing basket was a theme I noticed right away. While foreign to me because I never witnessed my grandmothers using them, I have adapted and learned. Awesome. I love that Bread Bosses also continue to provide great hints and instructions via email. Great purchase & company!
customer_reviews.author: donna briquet

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller loaves, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well for making medium-sized round loaves. Note that you will NOT get the coil pattern if you use the cloth liner (see picture), but you will still have a pretty round loaf. I made a batch of sourdough and finished one rising in the banneton and one in a regular mixing bowl - the banneton looked much neater and popped right out onto the tray. I did not have to use much flour at all on the cloth. The sellers also sent an e-recipe book, which was a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Halbany

customer_reviews.title: Great Proofing Basket
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of reviews before selecting this & I"m not disappointed! Arrived quickly and had great instructions with it plus they sent an email with a video. Sturdy and works great - I've used multiple times with different doughs with no issues. They also then gave me a free bread lame as well - great for baguettes! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great proofing basket
customer_reviews.text: We've been making bread for a while now and finally ordered a proofing basket. Worked great. We did use the liner it came with but it didn't work well since the dough still stuck to it even though it was floured. Other than that worked great, may try without the liner next time.
customer_reviews.author: Carly B.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Elevate your bread making instantly
customer_reviews.text: I have acquired a small collection of proofing baskets over the last year and this is by far my favorite. Only made a handful of loaves in it so can’t evaluate durability but first impressions are completely positive. The canes are clean, uniform, and cohesive; no stray chips, fibers or splinters. When dusted liberally with rice flour even very wet sourdoughs release easily. The pictures attest to the visual enhancement. Along with the Lodge combo cooker/Dutch Oven this tool has had the biggest impact on the quality of my handmade bread. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I realize nine inches is smaller than I anticipated but aside from not getting a tape out to see what the size would actually be ( seemed larger in photo ) I am looking forward to using the proofing basket for better results for my breads. I cannot say how the item works yet until I use it but it is as described -
customer_reviews.author: TheGirlFarmer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and great results!
customer_reviews.text: I love how perfect my breads have turned out since using this proofing basket! The instructions for care and use are very clear. My first loaf got a little stuck but I think I didn't put enough flour. Photo attached is my 3rd attempt at making a loaf and it came out gorgeous. I definitely recommend this product! Would have enjoyed a recipe or bread scoring ideas attached to the product it otherwise it's a very great basket.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine

customer_reviews.title: Use lots of flour in the basket and on the dough.
customer_reviews.text: We had tried a variety of bowls and methods for proofing our sourdough bread before we got this proofing system. The Banneton basket and liner are the solution we wanted. With a healthy dusting of flour, the bread releases easily. We have not used the basket without the cloth liner as we are very happy with the appearance of our loaves when using the liner. Very happy with this proofing basket.
customer_reviews.author: John W2000

customer_reviews.title: No Splinters!
customer_reviews.text: As a “frequent baker” with a large family I have several bannetons. The cheaper ones can be full of splinters that then get in my sourdough :( Overall I am very pleased with this kit and will be ordering additional pieces. Great service thank you.
customer_reviews.author: ganderbe

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Sturdy Banneton
customer_reviews.text: I am new to sourdough baking. This is a wonderful sturdy product. The inside of the basket is very smooth so there is no worry of wood chips. I am very happy with my purchase. I would like an oval but will wait a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Barnthson

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed a second banneton after starting a second batch of starter (because, well, what else is there to do on weekends now LOL). First was round so this one gave me a chance for a new shape and different cuts for decorations and it functions exactly as I expected. It looks small when compared to the round one but holds as much if not more dough. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Vehec

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous artisan bread
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy a traditional loaf of sandwich bread as much as the next baker, but for a more interesting and visually appealing loaf you can't go wrong with a banneton and this is one of the best I have ever used. Some have a rough unfinished interior, but this basket was smooth and perfect. This basket makes baking a loaf of bread fun and rewarding. I really wanted one of the elongated Banneton baskets. There are many available on line of differing quality. This Banneton basket is of exceptional quality.
customer_reviews.author: Neil J. Fruit, II

customer_reviews.title: Great Banneton! Do not fall for cheap imitations.
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully made Banneton! Great company! Customer service is top-notch! Prep your Banneton before using: 1. Spray the inside with water. 2. Dust with RICE flour. ( I bought a small stainless steel shaker with a mesh screen. It dispensed the perfect amount. ~$13 for 3- I used the other two for cinnamon, and for confectioner’s sugar.) 3. With the heel of your hand, tap the ouside of the Banneton while rotating it. This will completely coat the inside with RICE flour. 4. Repeat. 5. Absolutely no sticking! Success!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: it seems to have a funny smell though
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used it yet, it seems to have a funny smell though? I hope it meets my expectations, appears to be smaller in size then expected for a loaf of bread.? Please do not solicit me either. I received several emails from you and I had not even received my product.
customer_reviews.author: Stormin

customer_reviews.title: Great product with great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The banneton basket is solidily constricted with no erroneous pieces of wood. It seasoned beautifully. Shortly after ordering I got an email from Danny nforming me about the defect in the bowl scraper and how to go about correcting the issue. I have been following Bread Bosses on Instagram and they interact with everyone. Great product from a great company. Ignore how bad the loaf shape is. It stuck to my peel. But do notice how the design from the basket stuck well
customer_reviews.author: Salt City Foodie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Loved it so much I ordered two. The bread lame wasn’t initially included so I emailed the seller. They sent me two gorgeous lames. Super pleased with the product AND the company’s customer service team.
customer_reviews.author: Demeter

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I can complain about so far is the tiny strips or strings coming off the wood when I removed the cloth liner. I would think the bowl should be clean and free of these wood bits. I found that the liner fits on another bowl so I can make two loaves at once. The bowl works very well and I have no problem with the dough sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for reliable bannetons for months! After a not so pleasant experience with a different seller on Amazon I was recommended the Bread Bosses bannetons. I bought both the 9 inch boule basket and the 10 inch batard basket. Both arrived earlier than expected, with the basket, liner, and scraper. The baskets are surprisingly sturdy, and the purchase even came with a warranty and an invitation to the Bread Bosses website that has tips and recipes for sourdough bakers. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: R. Ash

customer_reviews.title: Making some baker quality bread, well it looks good at least!
customer_reviews.text: This item is great. I first was made aware of this through the book Flour, Water, Salt, Yeast. It has helped me make some very nice looking loaves of bread and using this side by side with another proofing bowl, the bread out of this one did have a better look to it. It came clean of splinters and well put together. When I go to purchase another proofing bowl, I will most certainly be buying another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Maxwell Means

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use proofing basket and liner
customer_reviews.text: I just started baking my own sourdough bread. The directions called for the use of a proofing basket, which to be honest, was a new concept to me. I followed the directions that came with the basket, made sure to liberally coat the liner with flour, and it worked beautifully! My bread "proofed" overnight in the fridge, and had very faint rings in the crust after it was removed and baked. I have used the basket once each weekend for the past 4 weeks, and am very happy with both the convenience of this method and it's ease of use. I'm going to ask for the round banneton (I have the oval) for mother's day.
customer_reviews.author: Kate O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This Bread Bosses proofing basket is fantastic. It produces a beautiful, perfectly round loaf that holds its shape through baking. Flour on the liner, I use brown rice, allows the proofed loaf to drop easily from the basket onto the baking vessel in preparation for baking. Then it's a snap to clean afterwards too. Great product and great value for the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time for me proofing dough in a basket. A bit of rice flour and it works great. It is easy to see the two baskets I bought are high quality. The edges materials are smooth, without shredding or splinters. I anticipate they will last me a long time and would not hesitate to buy additional sizes when I feel the need. The included accessories are a very nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

product_meta.title: 9 Inch Bread Banneton Proofing Basket - Baking Bowl Dough Gifts for Bakers Proving Baskets for Sourdough Lame Bread Slashing Scraper Tool Starter Jar Proofing Box
feature_bullets: GIFTS FOR BAKERS: PERFECT FOR ANY RECIPE Holds 1.5 pounds of dough with 9 inch (D) x 3.5 inch (H) size bread proofer basket , works well with any recipe involving Flour Water Salt and Yeast such as Lahey No Knead, Tartine Country, Glutenfree recipes, and many more and bread proofing bowl is capable of proving overnight in the fridge with a tightly cover bag

GIFT IDEAS FOR BAKERS: NATURAL RATTAN CANE MATERIAL sourdough bread banneton proofing basket set 9 inch proven to wicker moisture away from surface for crispy round crust, dough removes and releases nicely, sticks less and dust less flour on proving baskets over time
WELL MADE AND STURDY Banneton basket ridges/depth produces spiral ring patterns and bake thousands of French Artisan European style bakery batard loaves for life baking

VERY AFFORDABLE These bread making tools will score you more boules of this lovely quality for/with friends and family thanks to the included baking supplies such as the banetton, plastic dough bench scraper, proofing cloth liner, and sourdough starter kit e - book

HEALTHY BREAD brotform proofing bowls complies with German Food Safe so you can make healthier artisan bread. bread lame dough making scoring box tool kit works well at preparing dough before dough is placed in a Dutch Oven or La Cloche Baking Dome or Clay Bread Baker or Pizza Warming bread stone or Combo Cooker Pan with lid and more
